Sentencas: Apatite-type lanthanum silicate shows a high ionic conductivity and low activation energy at intermediate temperature (600-800 degrees C) compared with Yttria stabilized Zirconia (YSZ).
Titulo: Effect of substrate surface temperature on the microstructure and ionic conductivity of lanthanum silicate coatings deposited by plasma spraying

Sentencas: In addition, its excellent stability in a wide oxygen partial pressure range meets the requirement for the electrolyte.
Titulo: Effect of substrate surface temperature on the microstructure and ionic conductivity of lanthanum silicate coatings deposited by plasma spraying

Sentencas: Thus it is a potential candidate for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell (IT-SOFC) electrolytes.
Titulo: Effect of substrate surface temperature on the microstructure and ionic conductivity of lanthanum silicate coatings deposited by plasma spraying

Sentencas: Moreover, atmospheric plasma spraying is expected to be a promising alternative to other costly or low-deposition rate electrolyte processing methods.
Titulo: Effect of substrate surface temperature on the microstructure and ionic conductivity of lanthanum silicate coatings deposited by plasma spraying

Sentencas: However, the amorphous phase and pores existing in the plasma sprayed coatings might impair the stability and the higher ionic conductivity of lanthanum silicate.
Titulo: Effect of substrate surface temperature on the microstructure and ionic conductivity of lanthanum silicate coatings deposited by plasma spraying

Sentencas: The present work investigated the effect of substrate surface temperature from 545 degrees C to 900 degrees C on the microstructure and ionic conductivity of the lanthanum silicate coating.
Titulo: Effect of substrate surface temperature on the microstructure and ionic conductivity of lanthanum silicate coatings deposited by plasma spraying

Sentencas: The crystallinity of as-deposited coatings increased with the increase of substrate surface temperature, whereas the porosity showed a contrary tendency.
Titulo: Effect of substrate surface temperature on the microstructure and ionic conductivity of lanthanum silicate coatings deposited by plasma spraying

Sentencas: Ionic conductivity increased about four times with increasing substrate surface temperature, which is related to the low porosity and high crystallinity of coatings.
Titulo: Effect of substrate surface temperature on the microstructure and ionic conductivity of lanthanum silicate coatings deposited by plasma spraying

Sentencas: Increasing the substrate surface temperature during plasma spraying is a feasible method to increase ionic conductivity of the lanthanum silicate coatings by reducing the porosity and enhancing the crystallinity.
Titulo: Effect of substrate surface temperature on the microstructure and ionic conductivity of lanthanum silicate coatings deposited by plasma spraying
